author: John Cross
title: Diego Costa will be selling out if he quits Chelsea for China says Stamford Bridge predecessor Michael Ballack
text:
Sport Diego Costa will be selling out if he quits Chelsea for China says Stamford Bridge predecessor Michael Ballack "If you are on a high salary and are earning, let's say, enough money, it's something you should really think about — where you play, what level you play"     
Chelsea legend Michael Ballack has warned Diego Costa against going to China. 
Ballack claims Costa won't have enough time to spend all his money now, never mind if he left Stamford Bridge for the Chinese Super League — where Tianjin Quanjian have offered the striker wages of £30million-a-year. 
Former Germany midfielder Ballack also insisted the standard of football there is second rate compared to the Premier League. 
The ex-Blues star said: “It's crazy. It's numbers that we are not used to, even if in England there has been a lot of money involved for a while. It's still another level. 
“I don't think it's normal, but hopefully we come back a bit to normal days and players remember they are playing in the best league in the world. That's, I think, what counts for you as a player if you are on a high salary and you are earning, let's say, enough money… which you normally can't spend in your lifetime. "It's something you should really think about – where you play, what level you play, the audience. Football has a history and England has a history, and so does Spain and Germany and Europe as a whole. Football in Europe is No 1 and that is what everyone watches because the best players in the world compete in this area.” 
Costa was dropped by manager Antonio Conte after the Chinese offer turned his head. 
The Brazil-born striker has decided to stay at least until the summer but the Blues are expected to sell him at the end of the season, and it is clear the Spain international is considering moving to China. 
Ballack, talking at the launch of the Star Sixes tournament, added: “You love what you do but it's still a job and you are limited in time earning money and you think about that if someone makes you a crazy offer.
